column4: it doesn't look like my tasks in crontab are running. can i troubleshoot?
or enable crontab in some way
does /etc/crontab need to be enabled in ubuntu?
you just need to enter jobs
enter jobs?
you just need to define jobs in crontab....there is nothing to enable
http://www.pastie.org/1085170
where is my own crontab -- and why doesn't the system crontab work?
what makes you think the system crontab doesn't work?
well, first I suspect your passing parameters in the cron job is messing things up. Create a script that passes all that so you are using a one word command, or put the command in quotes
got it
thanks
that is a group, the password belongs to the user
so i want to create a user named passenger to deploy apps on my server
I have no idea what you are trying to accomplish, but you can't change the password because it is a group and not a user
i am just trying to add a user named 'passenger'
didn't this start with a question about 'sudo passwd passenger'?
then use either adduser or useradd, or do it through the gui
that is a group
those won't work because the group exists
if you defined the group by mistake remove it first, then add the user
bonhoffer: th0r: those won't work because the group exists
ZykoticK9 : a problem remains, i just created .ssh in ~ for passenger, look at the permissions: drwx------ 2       108 passenger 4096 Apr  9  2009 .ssh
